Hi, I am new to KSP (and games in general ), but I am having lots of fun!

I am currently on career mode, trying to get as much Science as I can, so to be able to acquire more stuff and er... think of good stuff to do on this marvelously free (as in fun) game...

While at this Sci-hunt process, I installed Science Library mod (before that I was using an .org file (Emacs great stuff)), which was REALLY tedious. This made Jeb's life WAY easier... So easy that something down there on the desert of my conscience became to bother haha

Does anyone (else? (I really don't know yet)) think that using Science Library can be considered cheating? If that is the case, under what circumstances?

Thanks and nice flights!
I don't think it is. If so then it would then be considered cheating to write everything down.

"Cheating" is hard to define in a single player game with no competitive angle whatsoever.

If it makes the game more fun, without making you feel bad about doing it, then go for it. If you feel like you're going to be robbing yourself out of a sense of eventual accomplishment without much added enjoyment here-and-now, then don't do it.

I personally enjoyed the experience of Doing Science for a while, and then installed a mod that told me when I was in a new Science Place so I could more quickly get through that part of it. Fun became drudgery so I removed the drudgery, allowing myself to do more fun.
If you install any mods at all you're cheating. Don't cheat, ever.

Don't mind Regex, he's getting old in his old age

There's no real cheating in KSP, unless you are entering a challenge posted by another player you are free to do what you like, and in challenge threads just stick to the challenge rules and spirit of the competition and everything will be fine.

Ultimately the only person you cheat is yourself, out of the satisfaction of accomplishing something in the game unaided.

Thanks everyone for the answers. I agree that the concept of cheating indeed tends to be rather subjective, given the game is ultimately individual. But, as the reason to play is to have fun, I think that every approach mentioned by you is valid... I will start by using it, then when I am better at flying and everything else maybe challenge myself a bit more!

Indeed I am not here that long, but recently I read some discussion about the MechJeb subject... Well, I think people tend to defend their point of view about what they do...

It's like playing Monopoly, every group of people has their own little different ways of playing the game.

From not buying the first round to forced to buy when you land on it.

If you think it makes the game more interesting then it's not cheating, even if it seems like cheating to someone else.

Or in other words; It's in the eye of the gamer.
Cheating is when you edit your persistent.sfs to give yourself science.

I guess I cheated then. But I like having everything at my disposal and playing a sandbox where all the science parts actually do something.

After just reading the headline: No, it is not.

You might loose the opportunity to learn to do things IN A GAME by yourself which you personally think of as no fun or miss out on a part of the journey, but cheating is hurting someone else in some way: financially, emotionally, to anothers disadvantage - all this you cannot do by playing a game by yourself the way you want to ... and even while some might get actually emotionally for you doing things differently, I ask you to listen to the song Let It Go from Frozen and think about the lyrics in several different ways.
